text: Edward Morgan Forster OM, CH (1 January 1879 â€“ 7 June 1970) was a British writer. Forster was born in Marylebone, London. He attended Tonbridge School, an independent school in Tonbridge, Kent. He studied at Kings College, Cambridge. Forster was a homosexualBritain Unlimited and wrote about homosexuality, class division and gender. His novels include Where Angels Fear to Tread, The Longest Journey, A Room with a View, Howards End, A Passage to India and Maurice.AP Central He also wrote short stories, plays, essays, libretti and travel guides. Forster died of a stroke in Coventry, Warwickshire. == References == Category:1879 births Category:1970 deaths Category:English LGBT writers Category:English novelists Category:Gay men Category:Writers from London
title: E. M. Forster
